Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and first class assistance from all staff.”
Reviews.Author: Liv_Sullivan
Reviews.Content: We were very fortunate to book this hotel, having spent a great amount of time weighing up the pros and cons of lots of options. We stayed for five nights and found the location to be fantastic - the views at breakfast from the balcony of the blue mosque were breathtaking - the balcony was also available at night to sit and have a drink and soak up the atmosphere. We stayed in a lower cost double room - the room was clean, simple, just what we needed - we were very comfortable during our stay in room 204. The most important feature of all was the staff. I was taken ill on the second night and had to go to hospital. The receptionist went the extra mile to ensure that I was OK - helping us with translations over the phone and relaying to us what was going on. We were so grateful for this. We will be sure to go back to continue with our trip, six days weren't enough! A perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “warm and friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Gerda F
Reviews.Content: a very nice tiny hotel directly opposite the blue mosque. wonderful views at night, when the mosque is lightened. very central and quiet. wonderful personal, very friendly and helpful people. the place to recommend for open-minded travellers. the terrace is nice too. and all the cats around in whole istanbul are terrace-jumping. only vegan food was missing at breakfast, but the rest was perfect for me to enjoy my first trip to istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: fpesca
Reviews.Content: on the plus side -excellent position to visit the historical Istanbul, close to the tramway -wonderful terrace in front of the blue mosque -friendly staff -free WIFI (if you have a SIP VOIP SW on your phone you can call home at ridiculus price) -each room is decorated with a personal style -low price (35â‚¬ per person per night) on the minus -our room (103) is rather small, no closet, the "double" bed 1.4m wide enclosed between 2 walls... this makes it impossible to enter in the bed from the side, you have jump on it from the foodside. - the room window opens to a narrow internal court, you could barely touch the wall in front, as result the room is rather dark -bathroom is even smaller, without a proper area for the shower. You have to shower on the floor between the door and the WC. As result after the shower the whole bathroom (not just the floor) is completely wet, no way to dry it untl the next morning. A few suggestions for the hotel 1) when there are other rooms free (as during our stay) avoid renting the worst ones. We have seen many rooms much better than ours (=proper bed, proper shower and proper window), free. I would have costed nothing and madea better service to the hotel name to assign us that ones. 2) when there is no proper shower area (such in room 103) at least provide some tool and addtional towels to clean and dry the bathroom after the shower

Reviews.Title: “Excellent backpacker hotel”
Reviews.Author: pbrennan908
Reviews.Content: This hotel calls itself a backpacker hotel, small, intimate, artistic, suitable for singles and young couples and I think it should be judged just on that. I like it. It has its idiosyncracies but I would like to underline the plusses which justify my â€œexcellentâ€� classification: great location, good views from some of the rooms but not all, homely feeling, relaxed and friendly atmosphere, charming, helpful staff, roof-top breakfast area and bar with very nice terraces, comfortable beds, very warm in Istanbul's cold winters. The best rooms: 205 is a very spacious room with two double beds one of which is in an alcove making it suitable either for use as a twin or for a couple with children. It has a very nice view over the Sea of Marmara, it is bright and very quiet. Room 201 where I have also slept, is a double room with a picture-postcard view of the Blue Mosque. Now, if you want to enjoy this view remember you will also be enjoying the prayers at five o'clock in the morning so if you are a fussy sleeper, dont get this room; otherwise, it is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Two old ladies”
Reviews.Author: nina o
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ararat hotel for 5 mights only, the room was warm, cozy and very clean, staff very friendly and helpful, we were privileged to watch the beautiful Blue Mosque every night and during our breakfasts from the hotel's terrace. We shall come back.

Reviews.Title: “A warm Welcome”
Reviews.Author: Nikos S
Reviews.Content: Do not hesitate to choose this small & charming hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet. Some rooms have an astonishing view of the Blue Mosque. If the weather is good you will be lucky enough to have breakfast on the terrace. The staff is very warm and helpful with anything you might need.

Reviews.Title: “Bagpacker's delight”
Reviews.Author: MomiTravels
Reviews.Content: If travelling alone or with friends and your bagpack & guitar, this is the place to stay in Istanbul. With a view of the Blue Mosque on one side and the glittering Marmara sea on the other, this hotel is conveniently located in the thick of things. The rooms are small, functional, clean and have plug points for your camera or phone charger. Each and every room have a unique look. The hotel provides simple and excellent breakfast of bread, feta, tomatoes, melons, spinach rolls, eggs to order and tea/ coffee. A common PC is available on the terrace level to access your facebook or email account. The terrace is a great place to eat your breakfast or just kill time between sightseeing by looking at people being busy all around with hoardes of Turkish artifacts being sold all around. The staff is non interfering and very helpful and easily give you information and local insight. Excellent and safe stay amongst an eclectic group of hotel guests. If travelling with children, this might not be the best place though.

Reviews.Title: “Charming rooms in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Dublindaze
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ararat hotel for six nights and it was just perfect. It's a very charming and cozy place and the staff are very warm and helpful. Every night, we felt like we were coming back home. The terrace with the beautiful Blue Mosque views is the best. Loved gazing at it during breakfast and planning out our day with this monument as our inspiration. Yes, the rooms are small, but we found it sufficient, especially since it was very clean and well-kept. I spent my birthday here, and it was really special. The flowers from the hotel only made it sweeter. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “A hostel with boutique hotel prices”
Reviews.Author: Trebbe
Reviews.Content: I booked a small room with a bathroom across the hall for â‚¬80, foolishly convinced by the paintings on the walls of the rooms, as shown on the internet, that this was an artistic hotel. What they did not say was that this "small" room had only enough space for a bed and dining chair, nothing else. And the bathroom was not only across the hall, you had to pass in front of the reception area to get to it. Every time the doorbell rang and people trooped up and down the stairs, and had conversations in the reception room, we heard it all clearly. The shower did not work and one of the bedside lamps was completely broken. That they are charging â‚¬80 for this room is outrageous. We moved the next morning to Hotel Grand Peninsula.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: kennyrich
Reviews.Content: A three night stay here was very enjoyable: it was like staying at a friend's place rather than a hotel. Very helpful staff, spotlessly clean, delicious breakfast on the roof terrace with stunning view of the Blue Mosque. The rooms are small, but nicely decorated and good value for being in the heart of things. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Lydia S
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel for three nights in early October. The location is great being within walking distance to most of the sights. The rooms have character as does the whole hotel including the great roof terrace. We spent a few evenings on the terrace talking to staff and found out some great tips on the city - transport, food etc Breakfast was also on the terrace, it was a good breakfast and the coffee kept coming, served by a lovely lady with a warm smile first thing in the morning. We had a front room looking out to the Blue Mosque and the call to prayer was all part of the experience. It is a special hotel that makes you feel safe, comfortable and welcome. Thank you to Hatice and the team for a memorable time.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JandAtogo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Ararat after our initial choice fell through. Haydar was fantastic from the outset and could not have been more helpful. The rooms are clean, beds are large and comfortable, showers are hot and have good pressure. Breakfast was tasty and plentiful. The hotel is right next to the Blue Mosque and near good restaurants... ask Haydar for his recommendation for a fish frestaurant, it's excellent. The hotel has rustic charm, nor new or modern. The rooftop terrace has sea breezes and amazing views of the Golden Horn one way and Blue Mosque the other. We have three recommendations for Hotel Ararat: stay here, stay here, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A charming boutique hotel with amazing views and great service”
Reviews.Author: PrincessKarlotta
Reviews.Content: The rooms are lovely and clean, some with great views over the Blue Mosque that is literally a block away. The paintings on the walls are fabulous and give real character to this little hotel with very helpful staff and a delicious breakfast. The views on the sea and on the Mosque from the terrace are just magnificent; nothing like having a drink while the sun sets over the evening prayer. Plain magical. Many thanks for all your help with the airport transfers, as well! Cheers :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AndySharp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our wedding anniversary and really enjoyed our time there. The staff are very friendly and you cannot beat the location. The rooftop terrace has SUBLIME views over the blue mosque and it's worth staying at this hotel for that reason alone. The rooms are very compact; we stayed in a standard double the first night and you will certainly be able to find rooms in other hotels with more space. Here, you are paying for the location and the character. Each room is painted with murals that give the rooms a really quirky, unusual feel - it's for those who want to stay somewhere a little different. We stayed at the back of the hotel and were completely untroubled by any traffic noise or the call to prayer. Given the location, there's a tremendous selection of bars and restaurants and with the Arasta bazaar opposite, the shopping is even better (it's more relaxed, less touristy and less claustrophobic than the grand bazaar). I would definitely recommend the garden cafe that's nearby (opposite the Blue House Hotel) where you can relax and enjoy good food, a bubble pipe and regular performances a whirling dervish while the locals play backgammon. The main sights are within easy walking distance; Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi, The Hippodrome and the Cistern can all be reached in 5-10 minutes. The Grand Bazaar is about 15 minutes away by foot. You really couldn't be better placed. For those with mobility problems, be aware that there is no lift and the stairs are tight. However, being at the top of the Sultanahmet hill, there's less of a trek to the sights. I thought about giving 4 stars for the review due to the size of the rooms. However, I think the price adequately reflects this and therefore it's 5 stars for the unbeatable location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Zen22
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because it was across from the Blue Mosque and near other attractions. Our room was small and sparsely furnished...no chair, very small bedside table...the bathroom was tiny and the shower unpredictable..but somehow it didn't matter. This place is magical because it puts you right in the heart of old Istanbul and the modern world fades away. Hearing the call to prayers was a moving experience...last one is at 10 PM and first one is at 5 AM. We arrived at night and got to see the Mosque lit up from the hotel terrace...beautiful. The breakfast was ample, varied, and fabulous and we ate on the terrace overlooking the Mosque. Must mention the friendly, helpful staff. One piece of our luggage didn't make it from Frankfurt and they made phone calls for us that greatly expidited its' recovery. Just one caveat...the hotel has narrow steep stairwells.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ove L
Reviews.Content: Absolutely charming small hotel with 11 rooms, of which several offers wonderful views of the Blue Mosque some 75 meters away. And if you lack that impressive view from the room, the two roof terraces offers astonishing views of the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia on one side, and wonderful views of the Marmara Sea, the Prince Islands and the Asian side of Istanbul on the other side. The room was small but charming and clean, and all you need in a town where you always want to be outside. Staff very kind, sweet and helpful, breakfast very good and served on the lovely terraces. We will definitely return to this hotel next time we visit Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Have the Blue Mosque as an alarm clock!”
Reviews.Author: firbolg
Reviews.Content: More like a hostel than a hotel but very quaint and cosy, and in an unbeatable location. Our room looked directly onto the Blue Mosque which meant no alarm clock was necessary! Staff very friendly and breakfast very filling, with lovely views from the roof terrace. Right in the heart of the action of Sultanahmet so walking distance to all the major historic sights. Also, lots of great eateries in the surrounding cobbled sidestreets.

Reviews.Title: “When I come back I know where to go”
Reviews.Author: GianniGorizia
Reviews.Content: It was a great emotion when I first saw the Blue Mosque just in front of me from the terrace of the hotel. Particular rooms, all of them with their particular charachter. Very clean. Gentle and swift staff. To sleep in a lovely place, to wake up and have breakfast on the terrace (Mrs. Sultan's cakes, a real turkish delight), a fresh Efes at night, before going tio sleep, listening to the muezzin's prayer: what do you want more?

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: heliantus
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a fantastic location, a wonderful terrace and the staff was friendly and helpful, but the room was terribly noisy place (also because of the air conditioning system) and... I got so many bed bugs bites that I had to undergo severe treatment upon my return back home!

Reviews.Title: “Good relationship quality/price...and a wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo M
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not fully furnished, but the position and the view of the Blu Mosque is perfect. Moreover the Ararat Hotel has a strategical position in the old Sultanhamet district

Reviews.Title: “We got charged just for the location”
Reviews.Author: MissJ21
Reviews.Content: We booked ourselves 2 rooms at this "centrally located" hotel for our first trip to istanbul and we were truly disappointed to say the least. The hotels website is highly misleading calling it the "art hotel" whilst there is nothing artsy about it. The rooms are tiny and there was hardly any place for us to fit our suitcases while making sure we dont get our toes injured. The breakfast didn't change for 4 days in a row and the over charged us for the airport pick up and drop. We woke up to dead bed bugs on the final day of our stay which made us skip breakfast that day. Zero Service + Bad Customer Care + Small Rooms and Over Priced Rooms made our trip to a beautiful city slightly unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money complete comfort!”
Reviews.Author: Waqas1987
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights! Firstly it has an excellent terrace which offers you a picturesque view of the blue mosque specially during the late evening tea at around 5ish! Secondly its location is ideal! V close to the blue mosque. Also at 15 mins walk from the hippodrome which is a must visit close to sunset time! Also close to the beach! Thirdly the staff was excellent! We came across mr hayder, khadija and gehad! Friendly bunch of people who make you feel at home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Amazing Terrace”
Reviews.Author: aleclerc
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Ararat during a trip to Istanbul in July. The folks that worked at the hotel were terrifically friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and creative, with walls painted differently in the various rooms. The Terrace was a huge highlight -- its views of the Blue Mosque and the water are amazing and the environment lends itself to chatting with fellow guests & travellers. Location is ideal, especially if you want to be based in Sultanahmet. The rooms all have AC and the hotel is equipped with WiFi + a computer for guests. Breakfast is included.

Reviews.Title: “A view to kill for!”
Reviews.Author: JanBrod
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and very friendly. The rooms are eccentrically decorated but a little small. It's no problem, but you do have to be well organised. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was lovely. And best of all, the view from the terrace would be hard to beat. Take ear plugs for the early call to prayer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, price and wonderful staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Starhemberg
Reviews.Content: Dear Haydar SarÄ±gÃ¼l We would like to say that we had a wonderful time in Istanbul. Really I have to say two weeks in Istanbul was one of the most interesting and best holiday trips I have ever experienced. Staying at the Ararat Hotel was fantastic. The location simply could not have been better. The food and service was excellent. Very clean. Interesting artistic rooms. What really made it a pleasure was your staff. All your staff were very helpful 'Sunman', Inna, 'Jhad' (sorry if I can't spell you names), courteous , patient and special thanks to Inna for the lovely breakfasts. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend your Hotel (well in fact we have) and hope to come back. A big thank-you to all. Elaine and Elgar

Reviews.Title: “a very friendly and comfortable resort for wonderful walks through the old city!”
Reviews.Author: Vilsendorf
Reviews.Content: Very hospitable, very friendly service, very good breakfast, nice, clean rooms, small, but sufficient, with modern bathrooms; free WiFi; an agreeable common room on the top floor with terraces overlooking the Bosphore and the Blue Mosque; an ideal resort for wonderful walks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: emmacave
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at The Ararat Hotel right opposite the Blue Mosque. We were welcomed warmly and looked after too well by Hattice, Zac and 2 other lovely ladies who fed us the most delicious breakfasts every morning and more. The location is magical, the rooms are small but comfortable and charming. The bombarded Hattice and Zac with endless questions about where and how to go!! they never tired! We will return!

Reviews.Title: “This place made our Istanbul trip”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller7080
Reviews.Content: We wanted a location which was very centrally located and Ararat Hotel was in the action spot. We had a great view of the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sophia was a few minutes away. There were lots of places nearby which served traditional Turkish cuisine. We were there for 3 nights and we could book all the tours in the agencies on Divan Olu and at the end of the day we got a good nights sleep. The receptions both during the night and the day were very courteous and helpful. The guy who works at night even gave us a great tip to go to Taksim using a cab and then via Havas bus to Sabhia Glocken airport. This cab ride would have been 55 Euros, we spent half of that getting there. This is a great place with a lot of character and best location money can buy. This was a stop over from our trip from Washington DC to India and we had a lot of luggage. They even gave us a larger room to store our luggage during our travels in Turkey. Be a Traveller - Not a Tourist!!

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul as you never saw it before!”
Reviews.Author: antoine0196
Reviews.Content: If you rate high excelent location, friendly atmosphere and warm welcome, Ararat should be on top of the list. Right behind the Blue Mosque, the 12 bedroom family hotel is the place to stay to visit the many gems of the city. You will then quickly forget that rooms and bathrooms are small and that there is neither table nor chest of drawers to unpack your suitcase. You will easily make acquaintance and new friends in the dining room between the terraces overlooking the Bosphorus and the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very kind staff, rooms a little too small”
Reviews.Author: micklupin
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great position next to the blue mosque; you can enjoy a very good breakfast in a terrace facing the blue mosque on one side, looking at the marmara sea on the other side. The staff was very kind and friendly all the time. The room was pretty nice even though really small, especially the bathroom (I have seen a smaller one only in Japan!): there are some bigger rooms, so if you are interested in that rather than the view maybe you can ask before booking (in the website they classify rooms only by the view). We really appreciated the absence of TV in the room! (we don't have it even at home...)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, cozy and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: Su_Om187497
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Ararat. The personnel is helpful and nice, the rooms are decorated with taste, and the views are absolutely breathtaking. Nothing compares to opening your window in the morning and having the Blue Mosque at close range. Breakfast at the terrace, Turkish or Continental style.

Reviews.Title: “OVERPRICED, TINY ROOMS, NOISY, AND OWNER HAS TERRIBLE MANNERS”
Reviews.Author: truthasiknowit10
Reviews.Content: the hotel forgot to pick us up after making arrangements and getting to Istanbul at 1am. The hotel was dark, noisy and nothing charming about it. No closets or storage area, no night tables or drawers. Decent rooftop, good location. Rooms were depressing, we got out asap especially after we heard and saw the owner pounding the desk and almost going to blows with a current customer that just arrived. Biggest mistake Lonely Planet ever did by recommending, they are either getting a kick back or have an arrangement with this place or a friendship. The rest of Turkey was truly amazing, as was our hotels and experiences with all of the people

Reviews.Title: “A window into the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: wintersmark
Reviews.Content: An excellent cosy little hotel in the most amazing part of the city, just a couple of minutes walk to the park, Sophia and the Blue Mosque. It's best feature is the rooftop terrace with views of the Blue mosque on one side and the Marmara Sea on the other. Staff very friendly, informal and relaxed but very efficient. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing, nicest staff I have ever met!! This hotel made our whole experience of Istanbul perfect!”
Reviews.Author: c_smittmeyer
Reviews.Content: The service was absolute topp class. There was always someone at the desk redy to help us with the smallest or biggest of problems. The hotel owner himself took us under his wings and showed us the best restaurants, good baklava places and was the best dinner company you can ask for! The rooms are small but comfortable and very clean!! The locations is more than perfect and there is a really nice top roof overlooking both the Bosphorus and the Blue Mosque. The breakfast is very good, both healthy and filling. The absolute best thing about this place is apart from all above, the atmosphere. Everyone staying there socialized and we shared unforgettable nights laughing and talking at the top roof :).

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: s2rabban
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ararat is the most memorable part of our trip to Istanbul. we didnt want to leave the hotel. The terrace rooftop was a great spot for relaxing and having a drink. The staff takes exceptional care of their guests. And the owner is a charming, inviting and welcoming person. I would only stay at this hotel next time im back in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: ademaria
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 2 min walk from Blue Mosque, less than 10 minutes from Aja Sofia and Topkapi. Great location. Classic turkish breakfast is included, as also free wi-fi connection. Our room was a little small, but with A/C and no noise from outside street. The staff was very friendly and open, and this could make the difference!

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of Sultanahmet!”
Reviews.Author: jkardon
Reviews.Content: This lovely, small hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet is run by a kind and warmhearted family that go to extreme lengths to make sure their guests are happy. The rooms are a little small but comfortable, very clean and air conditioned (a huge plus in Istanbul!) and the location cannot be improved upon-- it is literally a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. A fantastic, complimentary breakfast is served every morning from the top floor terraces, where you can choose to eat while looking at the Sea of Marmara or the Blue Mosque. I cannot say enough good about my experience in this hotel! I absolutely recommend everyone to consider staying at the Ararat.

Reviews.Title: “Exceedingly friendly”
Reviews.Author: AMPB
Reviews.Content: We totally enjoyed our recent stay at the Ararat Hotel. Everyone there was so kind and helpfull. We had a couple of issues with the A/C and shower, both of which were immediately addressed. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at Ararat”
Reviews.Author: DQChow
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Ararat hotel and it was an excellent experience. The staff was amazingly friendly, helpful and considerate with a useful suggestion/solution for every question asked. They were accomodative of all the unusual request a family with teenagers may have. The breakfast was wonderful - the quality and preparation of the food and the cook. The location is ideal to visit the old city. One can see all of the old city by walking from the hotel. The terrace view during breakfast (or any other time) is particularly beautiful - a full view of the blue mosque! We certainly look forward to a stay at this hotel again in future. We got a lot of value for the money - not only in food and comfort, but also the friendship and cultural education we got from the staff. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants an authentic Istanbul experience.

Reviews.Title: “great location & host; basic accommodations”
Reviews.Author: jachp
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed our stay at the Ararat Hotel. We were just outside the Arasta Bazaar and walking distance to all other sights. The hotel staff was very friendly -- when we had questions about the train system and schedule for the next leg of our trip, they sent someone to find the information for us. Then we we made our decision, they went and purchased the tickets for us. we also used them to arrange for airport pick up -- the charge was by the vehicle, not per person so it was well worth it since there were 3 of us. the rooms were very basic but clean. The breakfast was fresh and had nice variety of bread, cheese, hard boiled eggs, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gigi003
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay in Sultanahmet. The staff was very helpful and the owner is charming. Breakfast is amazing. I will stay at the Ararat again!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: HaroldShand
Reviews.Content: You have not truly lived until you have experienced the sumptuous breakfasts at the Ararat Hotel. They are served on a roof terrace which is almost literarlly in the shadow of the Blue Mosque. It is a magical introduction to Istanbul. The staff are as friendly as you will find anywhere. They really went the extra mile, sourcing ideas and giving us advice and inspiration. All rooms are individually painted, which is a nice touch. They are equipped with air conditioning, which is a must. There is a communal computer with free internet access. We had a wonderful stay and would warmly recommend it. The location and staff cannot be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “..a homey, relaxed and friendly place to stay in a bustling, beautiful city..”
Reviews.Author: Marion51
Reviews.Content: Even though the rooms were small, and ours was right off the dining/breakfast area, the receptionist and the breakfast staff were extremely helpful, friendly and pleasant. The view from our top floor room (which was mentioned in the Lonely Planet as one of the "smaller rooms") was still bigger and more spacious than roms in other hotels we visited. The view of the Blue Mosque from the breakfast terrace was spectacular! Unfortunately, the stairs might be a problem for some people, and yet we still saw elderly people making the trek and enjoying the experience. The staff was etremely helpful in finding us another room for family members when most hotels were booked.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time, extraordinary town and great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cherch
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Istanbul and the accomodation in the Hotel was excellent. Very, very friendly people and great support to any questions around our stay (restaurants, town guidance,..). In addition, the possibility to have our breakfast on the terrace with a nice view either to the seaside or to the Blue Mosque was the right thing to start each day or end the day with a nice apperitive enjoying the lights of Istanbul. The small size of the Hotel, the family driven style of management and the different spoken languages allowed to exchange about Istanbul and the culture with the Hotel personal and other guests easily - this was a great ad on to appreciate Istanbul even more.

Reviews.Title: “So close to all the activity and yet distant enough - with superb hosts”
Reviews.Author: Tarutzy
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul 2 nights at the Ararat hotel before heading south. I was very impressed with the cleaniness and freshness of the rooms with varnished dark wood floors. The hotel has a homely approachable feel to it. I also liked the character/style of the rooms simply creative and cosy. The housekeepers are very nice and do a great job. The breakfast in the morning is delicious and you can sit in the balconies with great views. The hotel receptionist manager is very friendly offering great advice about where to eat/where to go/transport tips. I also had the privilege of meeting the proprietor, a very charismatic, witty and generous man. My holiday in Turkey has been the most memorable and thanks to the warmth of the Turkish people, their rich culture and great fresh food!

Reviews.Title: “thanks”
Reviews.Author: butterfly_ist
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable and peaceful hotel. great price I recommend

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place and a great host!”
Reviews.Author: galileetgalilee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel a couple of nights and loved it. Having tried others places in Sultanahmet, this one is by far the best, both for comfort and sight (best view on Blue Mosque!) and on the budget side too!! The rooms are very confortable and decorated with taste. And the space in general carries an authentic touch (not "postcard", just genuine). A lot of attention is paid to details: traditionnal olive soap, original paintings, consistent decoration (NOT the case in other places in the area), VERY good breakfast (homemade crepes, cake and fruits)... Above all, the personnality and charm of the owner, Haydar, makes it worth to pay him and his hotel a visit, at least for a glass of Raki at a sunset. But if you manage to get a room, don't hesitate!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, beautiful view and wonderful staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: lucivinedenfer
Reviews.Content: We were stucked in Istanbul a few days more during the problems due to the volcanic cloud and I would like to thank all the staff from hotel Ararat! They were so nice with us! Trying to help us to find a solution! If I come back in the future in Istanbul, I will surely choose hotel Ararat again for their lovely rooms, the fabulous view on the Blue Mosk when you are on the roof terrasse and most of all, the kindness of the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Terrace - Great Proprietor”
Reviews.Author: brunoboris
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few years ago based on the recommendation of a friend. She wasn't wrong. Located in the Sultanahmet neighborhood, it's near many of the historic sites and the light rail. Having breakfast on the top floor/terrace was nearly sublime - looking out over the Sea of Marmara or soaking up the warm brown tones of the rooms. The manager/owner of the place is fantastic. Great to talk to.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the Old City”
Reviews.Author: pegmoro
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our recent visit to the Hotel Ararat very much...it is attractive, clean and very conveniently located for all the Old City sites...it is literally in the shadow of the Blue Mosque - an amazing sight to wake up to...be aware of the call to prayer first comes at 5 a.m. and echoes throughout the Old City...also the room was not dark, so take a sleep mask...but the staff is very nice and the breakfast, delicious - again with great views on both sides...enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable days”
Reviews.Author: genoa_dolphin
Reviews.Content: during a tour all around the Turkey my girlfriend and I stayed 5 days in Istanbul... we could define them 'unforgettable'. beyond the city, the accomodation in ararat hotel was pleasant and amusing. the rooms are little but hospitable. the host is a beautiful person, who entertains his guests with interesting discussions, and the staff is very friendly. What about other? we reccomend this hotel to everyone wants to have an expecial experience in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent position for a good, "familiar" hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaMotte72
Reviews.Content: Ararat hotel is located in a excellent position, right near the Blue Mosque, in un'area with a lot of restaurants, bars and so near to the main touristic attractions (blue mosque, santa sophia, topkapi palace..) The rooms are clean and smart, although very small and next to each other (you can hear the others speak). Breakfast is good, and served in a terrace with a beautiful view. Service is very kind. Prices are very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think of going to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michel013
Reviews.Content: Don't even think of going to this hotel.It's not even a hotel,just a lodging house charging superior hotel prices.It's a scandal. Our room on top floor was miniscule and basic ,the bathroom barely room to stand up in.It was also directly onto breakfast area with just a wooden partition not a proper wall so when staff and guests came up you were woken up by the noise and it sounded like people were actually coming into your room! How this place got into Lonely Planet and Routard is beyond comprehension. We got out as soon as possibleand found a perfectly acceptable hotel in same area for lower price. This place must be one of the worst rip-offs ever.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Ararat Hotel, save your money and go elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: insettofoglia
Reviews.Content: Ararat hotel is simply a misleading project. It's not a one star hotel, it's barely a one star hotel. Rooms are small, views from rooms are a joke, staff are unfriendly. I ended up carrying my materass in the room myself. Their prices are way above what they should be and their website is grossly misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in centre of old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: maryhalsey
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, generous, warm and magnaminous host; unique, individual rooms and accommodation. Experience the comfort needed for a 50 year old in surroundings that touch on memories of the student trip with a rucksack. Delightful eating area at the top of the building with an outside terrace which lies under the shadow of the blue mosque. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Home from Home at the Hotel Ararat”
Reviews.Author: Gizemax
Reviews.Content: For myself the the two indespensible requirements of any hotel are cleanliness and a good shower and in the Hotel Ararat these prerequisites are met. Although the hotel does not have some of the facilities that the 5 star world traveler may consider nessessities, swiming pools, spas etc it uses the advantages it possesses to great effect. The rooms though simple in their layout are cosy, clean and have a charm not to be found in the standard homogenous hotel rooms of the world. The roof top dining/lounge area in which a traditional turkish breakfast plate is served (in my experience when I got up rather than when the hotel thought I aught to be having breakfast, another nice touch) is fitted out in warm wooden panelling which brought to mind a ships interior and provides the guest with a warm and relaxing place to read and think. One of Hotel Ararat greatest assets is its location. Found right in the heart of the Sultanahmet two terraces, accessable from the roof top lounge area, command outstanding views of the Blue Mosque and the sea of Marmara. Mention can not be made of the Hotel Ararat with out a word on the staff who are both warm and freindly and compliment the very homely surroundings perfectly. Definitely somewhere I would stay again. Max McNally, Scotland
